reasoning: Occurs when molar tissue invades the myometrium, developing in approximately 15-20% of complete molar pregnancies. Estimated at ~0.3 per 100k person-years. Requires chemotherapy in most cases.
source: Lurain JR. (2010). Gestational trophoblastic disease I: epidemiology, pathology, clinical presentation and diagnosis of gestational trophoblastic disease, and management of hydatidiform mole. Am J Obstet Gynecol. 203(6):531-539
